intro: Stellilabium boylei, commonly known as the Boyle's star-labium, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Stellilabium boylei is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often going dormant during periods of extreme drought.
